channel.title: Bloomberg Markets
channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 BLOOMBERG L.P. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED

item.title: Global Euro Moment Needs Decisive Actions, ECB’s Lagarde Says
item.description: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde called on policymakers to seize the moment and increase the euro’s global profile as Donald Trump’s policies undermines confidence in the US dollar.
item.dc:creator: Mark Schroers

media:content.media:description: Christine Lagarde, president of the European Central Bank (ECB), at a rates decision news conference in Frankfurt, Germany, on Thursday, June 5, 2025. The ECB lowered interest rates for the eighth time in a year after inflation dipped beneath 2% and the economy suffered repeated blows from US tariffs. Photographer: Alex Kraus/Bloomberg

item.title: Japan Bond Futures Dip After BOJ Plans Slower Bond Buying Cuts
item.description: Japanese bond futures slipped after the central bank held rates steady and said it would slow its tapering of government bond buying from the start of the next fiscal year.
item.dc:creator: Mia Glass

item.title: Bank of Japan Holds Rates, Plans Slower Withdrawal From Bond Market
item.description: The Bank of Japan left its benchmark rate unchanged on Tuesday and said it would slow its tapering of government bond buying from the start of the next fiscal year. Bloomberg's Shery Ahn reports from Tokyo. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Oil Advances, US Futures Drop With Iran in Focus: Markets Wrap
item.description: US and European stock futures fell and oil rose after President Donald Trump called for the evacuation of Tehran, in comments that contrasted with earlier optimism that Israel-Iran tensions wouldn’t escalate into a wider conflict.
item.dc:creator: Joanna Ossinger

media:content.media:description: Market information displayed inside The Tokyo Stock Exchange (TSE) building, operated by Japan Exchange Group Inc. (JPX), in Tokyo, Japan, on Wednesday, April 9, 2025. Japanese stocks tumbled as concerns about US trade tariffs and wild swings on Wall Street sapped investor confidence, while the yen extended its rally.

item.title: Britain's Housing Splurge Is Long Overdue
item.description: The Labour government’s plan to boost spending on affordable homes has the potential to pay for itself in wider economic benefits.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Brooker

media:content.media:description: ASHFORD, KENT - JULY 11: Construction work takes place on a short-term pod housing project for the homeless at Henwood Industrial Estate on July 11, 2024 in Ashford, Kent. The project, in which 23 pods will provide temporary accommodation to people facing homelessness, is scheduled to be completed in September with its first residents moving in soon thereafter. The project was spearheaded by Ashford Borough Council with additional funding coming from the national government. (Photo by Chris J Ratcliffe/Getty Images)

item.title: Trump ‘Revenge’ Tax Prompts AMP to Halt Long-Term US Investments
item.description: One of Australia’s top asset managers has frozen new long-term investments in the US, citing mounting uncertainty over President Donald Trump’s policies.
item.dc:creator: Amy Bainbridge, Adam Haigh

item.title: Iron Ore Extends Drop as Demand Concerns Rise, Citi Cuts Targets
item.description: Iron ore headed for the lowest close since September on a seasonal slowdown in demand and signs Chinese mills are curbing steel output.
item.dc:creator: Katharine Gemmell, Winnie Zhu

item.title: Oil Moves Higher After Trump Calls for Evacuation of Tehran
item.description: Oil jumped after US President Donald Trump called for the evacuation of Tehran, before paring gains, as the market remained on edge about an escalation in the conflict with Israel that could disrupt crude supply.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Chen

media:content.media:description: Smoke billows for the second day from the Shahran oil depot, northwest of Tehran, on June 16, 2025.

item.title: RBI May Have Easing Room if Inflation Undershoots, Governor Says
item.description: India’s central bank may have space for further policy easing if inflation undershoots its projections, according to Governor Sanjay Malhotra.
item.dc:creator: Subhadip Sircar, Bhaskar Dutta

item.title: South Korea’s Equity Rally Boosts Market Value Above $2 Trillion
item.description: South Korea’s stock market value has regained the $2 trillion mark after a three-year setback, the latest in a series of bullish milestones amid enthusiasm for corporate reforms and AI chip trades.
item.dc:creator: Youkyung Lee

item.title: India's Energy Index Struggles at Key Level With Rising Oil Prices
item.description: Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:
item.dc:creator: Ashutosh Joshi

item.title: Trump to Abruptly Depart G-7
item.description: US President Donald Trump says he will depart the Group of Seven leaders’ summit in Canada, hours after he took to social media to call for the evacuation of Iran’s capital Tehran. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Can't Give Up on Buy the Dip Yet, Pepperstone's Weston Says
item.description: Chris Weston of Pepperstone Group says he doesn't think "we can necessarily give up on buy the dip yet" despite the fluid trading environment. He shares his views on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: SoftBank Sells T-Mobile Stake for $4.8 Billion to Fund AI Push
item.description: SoftBank Group Corp. raised around $4.8 billion through a sale of T-Mobile US Inc. shares, a move that helps fund the Japanese company’s grandiose plans for artificial intelligence.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Hughes

media:content.media:description: A T-Mobile store in New York, US, on Monday, Oct. 21, 2024. T-Mobile US Inc. is scheduled to release earnings figures on October 23.

item.title: Citi Calls Time on Gold’s Rally Due to Slumping Demand, Fed Cuts
item.description: Gold is expected to sink back below $3,000 an ounce in the coming quarters as a record-setting rally runs out of steam, according to Citigroup Inc., calling time on one of the standout rallies in commodities.
item.dc:creator: Jake Lloyd-Smith

media:content.media:description: One kilogram gold bars at The Vaults Group gold dealers arranged in Barcelona, Spain, on Monday, April 28, 2025. Gold was steady after dropping Tuesday as President Donald Trump eased the impact of some auto tariffs and pointed to progress in trade negotiations with several countries. Photographer: Angel Garcia/Bloomberg

item.title: New World Bondholders Receive Interest Payment on Dollar Note
item.description: New World Development Co. has paid interest due on a dollar note, according to several bondholders, giving the indebted Hong Kong builder some breathing room as it works to complete an HK$87.5 billion ($11.1 billion) loan refinancing deal.
item.dc:creator: Jackie Cai, Trista Xinyi Luo, Pearl Liu

item.title: Chow Tai Fook Jewellery Upsizes Convertible to $1.1 Billion
item.description: Henry Cheng’s Chow Tai Fook Jewellery Group Ltd. has raised HK$8.8 billion ($1.1 billion) from a larger-than-planned sale of convertible bonds, making it one of Hong Kong’s biggest this year.
item.dc:creator: Dave Sebastian

media:content.media:description: A Chow Tai Fook Jewellery Group store in Hong Kong.

item.title: KKR Buys Australian Off-Grid Power Specialist Zenith Energy
item.description: KKR & Co. has agreed to buy Australia’s Zenith Energy, a provider of off-grid power systems, from a group including Pacific Equity Partners Pty Ltd., OPSEU Pension Trust and Foresight Group Holdings Ltd.
item.dc:creator: Rob Verdonck, Keira Wright

item.title: Mitsubishi Said in Advanced Talks on $8 Billion Aethon Deal
item.description: Mitsubishi Corp. is in advanced talks to buy the assets of Aethon Energy Management for close to $8 billion, people familiar with the matter said, in what would be the Japanese conglomerate’s biggest ever acquisition.
item.dc:creator: David Carnevali, Dinesh Nair, Manuel Baigorri, Ruth Liao

media:content.media:description: Pedestrians walk past the Mitsubishi Corp. headquarters, center, at night in Tokyo, Japan, on Monday, Sept. 22, 2014. Mitsubishi, Japan's biggest trading house, proposed to buy Norwegian fishery Cermaq ASA for 8.88 billion kroner ($1.4 billion) to expand its foods business.

item.title: Oil Freight Rates Jump in Mideast as Iran Conflict Fans Risk
item.description: Oil-shipping rates for Middle Eastern routes have spiked after some tanker owners and managers paused offering vessels as they assess risks from Israel’s conflict with Iran, fueling concerns over flows from the region.
item.dc:creator: Serene Cheong, Yongchang Chin

item.title: Tourism Dip Fuels Worst Stock Drop in Asia at Thai Airport Firm
item.description: Thailand’s post-Covid flood of tourists has turned into more of a trickle, adding to concerns for Airports of Thailand Pcl as it grapples with shrinking duty-free sales without a full-time chief executive officer.
item.dc:creator: Anuchit Nguyen

media:content.media:description: Chinese travelers have turned away from the Southeast Asian nation after the viral kidnapping of a Chinese actor in January stoked worries about security. Photographer: NurPhoto/NurPhoto

item.title: William Bagley, Beleaguered First CFTC Chairman, Dies at 96
item.description: William T. Bagley, a veteran California legislator who moved to Washington to preside over the chaotic first years of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission as its founding chairman, has died. He was 96.
item.dc:creator: Gabriel Baumgaertner

media:content.media:description: William T. Bagley in 2002. Photographer: Frederick M. Brown/Getty Images

item.title: Gold Pushes Higher as Trump’s Tehran Warning Sparks Haven Buying
item.description: Gold pushed higher in early Asia trading after US President Donald Trump called for the immediate evacuation of Tehran, boosting demand for havens as investors track hostilities between Israel and Iran.
item.dc:creator: Jason Scott

media:content.media:description: One kilogram gold bars at the ABC Refinery smelter, operated by Pallion, in Sydney, Australia, on Thursday, April 17, 2025. Gold paused its record-breaking rally amid optimism over US-Japan trade talks, after bullion earlier reached another all-time high. Photographer: Brendon Thorne/Bloomberg

item.title: South Korea Looks to MSCI Review With Renewed Hopes for Upgrade
item.description: South Korea’s efforts to improve corporate governance as well as end a controversial short-selling ban have strengthened the nation’s bid for an upgrade to developed-market status in MSCI Inc.’s indexes.
item.dc:creator: Winnie Hsu, John Cheng, Sangmi Cha

item.title: MakeMyTrip Seeks Over $2 Billion in Shares, Convertible Sale
item.description: MakeMyTrip Ltd. is seeking to raise more than $2 billion in concurrent sales of shares and convertible bonds, as the US-listed Indian travel firm aims to buy back a stake held by Trip.com Group Ltd.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Hughes

media:content.media:description: CANADA - 2025/02/06: In this photo illustration, the MakeMyTrip Limited logo is seen displayed on a smartphone screen. (Photo Illustration by Thomas Fuller/SOPA Images/LightRocket via Getty Images)

item.title: Hedge Fund Up 42% Last Year Offloads Its Biggest Winner Nvidia
item.description: Hedge fund founder Jonah Cheng calls Nvidia Corp. the best pick of his career. But he has now sold the last of his shares in the company, expressing doubts about the outlook for the $3.5 trillion chipmaker.
item.dc:creator: Cindy Wang

item.title: Stocks Rise as Fear of All-Out Mideast War Eases | The Close 6/16/2025
item.description: Bloomberg Television brings you the latest news and analysis leading up to the final minutes and seconds before and after the closing bell on Wall Street. Today's guests are Tom Tzitzouris, Strategas Securities, Jay McCanless, Wedbush Securities, Amrita Sen, Energy Aspects, Ryan Crocker, Former Ambassador, Chris Palmeri, Bloomberg News, Shelby McFaddin, Motley Fool, Dana Peterson, The Conference Board, Damola Adamolekun, Red Lobster CEO, David Gura, Bloomberg News, Lars Barstad, Frontline Management CEO, Bozoma “Boz” Saint John. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Saskatchewan Could Double Oil Output to 1 Million Barrels a Day, Premier Says
item.description: Saskatchewan could more than double oil production to as much as 1 million barrels a day if federal regulations were eased, Premier Scott Moe said.
item.dc:creator: Robert Tuttle

media:content.media:description: An oil rig in Stoughton, Saskatchewan, Canada on Oct. 20, 2019.

item.title: Unclear Who Takes Over If Iran Collapses, Says Fmr Ambassador
item.description: Ryan Crocker, Former Ambassador to Afghanistan, Iraq, Pakistan, Syria, Kuwait & Lebanon speaks with Alix Steel and Romaine Bostick about the Iran & Israel conflict and nuclear sites being affected. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Oil Hedges Seeing a Huge Spike on Israel-Iran: Expert
item.description: Amrita Sen, Energy Aspects, Founder & Director of Research speaks with Alix Steel and Romaine Bostick about Iran and Israel conflict and the oil industry. (Source: Bloomberg)
